The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide

wikitext.*:
'''The Name Coventry''' is the published title of a [[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"|letter]] from [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] to the Editor of ''[[Wikipedia:The Catholic Herald|The Catholic Herald]]'', written on [[10 February|10]]-[[11 February]] [[1945]].<ref name=CG>{{CG|C}}, pp. 287-8</ref>

*'''Subject:''' Tolkien discusses the derivations of "[[Wiktionary:convent|convent]]" and "[[Wiktionary:Coventry|Coventry]]", and English place-names in general.<ref name=CG/><ref name=TB1>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.tolkienbooks.net/php/details.php?reference=31250|articlename=Catholic Herald. 1945|dated=|website=TB|accessed=8 July 2012}}</ref>
*'''Publication:''' The letter was published in [[The Catholic Herald (23 February 1945)|''The Catholic Herald'' (23 February 1945)]].<ref name=CG/><ref name=TB1/><ref>{{webcite|author=From Professor Tolkien|articleurl=http://archive-uat.catholicherald.co.uk/article/23rd-february-1945/2/i-the-name-coventry-from-professor-tolkien---wi |articlename=The Name Coventry|dated=23.2.1945|website=Catholic Herald|accessed=11 February 2021}} ([https://web.archive.org/web/20210211084306/http://archive-uat.catholicherald.co.uk/article/23rd-february-1945/2/i-the-name-coventry-from-professor-tolkien-sia--wi archived: Wayback Machine]).</ref> Extracts from the letter also appeared in [[The Catholic Herald (18 September 1981)|''The Catholic Herald'' (18 September 1981)]].<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.tolkienbooks.net/php/details.php?reference=31260|articlename=Catholic Herald. 1981|dated=|website=TB|accessed=8 July 2012}}</ref>
